New Records: Kyle Higashioka became the first Padres catcher to homer in consecutive playoff games.
Key Match Events: Kyle Higashioka's solo homer started a five-run rally against an ailing Max Fried with two outs in the second inning.

Manny Machado added a two-run double with the bases loaded and Jackson Merrill, a top contender for NL Rookie of the Year, followed with a two-run triple as the sellout crowd of 47,705 — the largest in Petco Park history — roared.
Jorge Soler hit a solo homer in the fifth and Michael Harris II had a two-run shot in the eighth.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres, who would love to win a World Series title in memory of late owner Peter Seidler, head up Interstate 5 to face Shohei Ohtani and the NL West rival and top-seeded Los Angeles Dodgers in a National League Division Series beginning Saturday evening at Dodger Stadium.
Post-Match Reflections: This team's always shown the ability to be resilient and never quit,” Higashioka said. “That’s a credit to all the guys. Just putting together good at-bats no matter what.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres, who eliminated the 111-win Dodgers in a 2022 NLDS, swept the Atlanta Braves with a 5-4 win in Game 2 of their NL Wild Card Series on Wednesday night.
Robert Suarez pitched a perfect ninth for the save.
Others: The sellout crowd of 47,705 — the largest in Petco Park history — roared.
Max Fried was hit on the left hip by a ball off the bat of Fernando Tatis Jr. two batters into his outing and left after the second inning.
Joe Musgrove left with right elbow tightness with two outs in the fourth after throwing two slow curveballs to Matt Olson.
